name: Hotel Galleria

reviews.text: My daughter dreamed of going to Venice after a schoolmate told her about her trip there. Unlike many other Americans we were on a tight budget. We used frequent flier miles to get to Venice and only stayed for a long weekend (5 days) because that's what our budget allowed.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Venice for anyone with a dream and a budget

likes.liked: — The location! Right on Canal for a fraction of the going rate!

reviews.title: Great hotel with a friendly owner!
reviews.text: The Galleria is the real deal! A dream! Our room was miniscule - not much bigger than the size of the full size bed. But the windows opened right on the Canal!!! It was fantastic! The owners were polite and helpful and we were centrally located.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a little restaurant right downstairs and for about $20 or 30 US - we could have a small pizza, my daughter a coke, and I could have a glass of wine.
reviews.title: A real find

likes.liked: — The View from the window over the grand canal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you dream of Venice, but have nightmares about how to afford it - this is the way to go!
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prego!
reviews.title: Wonderful views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful gem! We just got married and I took a job in Italy. Staying at this hotel was the start of our honeymoon and move to a new country. The staff was wonderful, the view from the room was spectacular, and the location was fantastic.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have traveled around the world and this is my favorite gem. Anyone who complains has not been outside of a chain hotel. Yes the breakfast is continental, but that is the norm in Venice!
reviews.title: Great location and friendly staff

reviews.text: My wife and I are planning a few more stops at this hotel while in Italy! Enjoy the ambiance and great views and fantastic location! Next door to a great museum, right above Rick Steve's favorite Venetian pizzaria, and a block away from the Guggenheim Museum!
reviews.title: Impressive Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really enjoyed this hotel. Eating breakfast while looking out onto the Grand Canal was worth every penny. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The only thing negative I would say is that the walls are thin and when someone in the next room would close a door it almost felt like our door was being closed. I don't really think this is the hotel's fault. It's an old building and I think that's just what happens. I also wish it had TVs and Internet, but when you have a view of the Grand Canal, I guess you can live without that.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Galleria! Great location and charm!

likes.liked: — The small touches that made you feel welcome! Also, the views from your room!

reviews.text: We just recently stayed at the Hotel Galleria in Venice and had an absolutely wonderful experience. The hotel is in a central location, right beside the Academia bridge, and has a good view of the central canal. You are a short walk from most attractions in Dorsoduro and San Marco (and the Academia water taxi stop is less than a block away). The Hotel Galleria really outdoes itself with personal attention and customer service. Albert, a regular front desk agent, accomodated an extra person in my single room by providing another bed, sheets, and even a pillow (all hotels were full on that night). Every tourist question we had was answered in a friendly manner (unlike some other places in Italy!). The hotel, for location and staff, was very reasonably priced for Venice. You could spend much more money on a hotel in Venice, and the only noticeable difference would be air conditioning.
reviews.title: Great place - if only...

likes.liked: — Location, decor, cleanliness, value for money, views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A traditional hotel that is very clean and had a great location. With a great location however comes noise, so if you are a light sleeper or go early to bed early this may not be the hotel for you. Breakfast was nice served in the room each day. Ideal for a short stay.
reviews.title: Traditional Hotel in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful! Cute hotel with great view! Everyone at desk very kind, breakfast in room was great! We stayed in room 8 for 2 nights, loved the view! We would stay here again for sure if returning to Venice- great location!
reviews.title: Little Venice Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was, honest to God, the nicest little hotel I've ever stayed in. There was a lovely buzz every morning of the ferry boats and cafe outside. The rooms were lovely and warm and totally clean with plush decor. The served-in-your-room breakfast was delicious and perfect. Our room had a view of the Accademia Bridge and if you strained your neck a little you could see the Grand Canal.
reviews.title: Brilliant

likes.disliked: — Our double bed was two single beds shoved together.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there during the Venice Carnival which I would totally recommend. The streets/waterways were filled with people donning amazing costumes.
reviews.title: Yet another rave
An ideal place to stay in Venice
reviews.text: The staff were kind and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just spent two nights at the Hotel Galleria and would definitely recommend it (although we decided that, for us, Venice is a day trip only and probably wouldn't stay overnight again). If you are spending a few days, though, the Galleria is a terrific little hotel with a friendly, helpful staff and convenient location. We loved having breakfast delivered to our room :-)
reviews.title: Nice Place!

reviews.text: Although now October my wife and I, who are retired along with another retired couple from the UK, all stayed at this hotel for 3 nights Aug.21-23 2007 it was our first visit to Venice.
reviews.title: Did Not Disappoint
Perfect Location
reviews.text: My wife and I have only just returned home to NZ hence some delay in writing this report.

This Hotel, which I booked primarily because of the Trip Advisor reviews did not disappoint. It met our expectations; rooms are small but that's just Venice, besides, how much time do you spend in the rooms?. Our friends had a small but adequate en-suites whereas my wife and I had to use a shared bathroom. This was no problem and it was always clean and well presented. We had breakfast in the rooms which was excellent. It was perfectly situated right alongside the Grand Canal by the Academia Bridge. The staff (owner operator) were pleasant and helpful gave good advise as as required. We don't think you will find a better Hotel at the price. All four of us agreed that if we ever return to Venice, which is more likely for our friends from England, we would almost certainly book in at this place again.
reviews.title: Fantastic find
Perfect Venice Experience
reviews.text: My husband and i stayed in the first room next to the front desk for 5 nights. It was nosely as the person on duty had a friend and they were talking long after 11:00pm. I asked them to please lower the tone and they did. The room was small but we had no problem adjusting to the size. The breakfast was excellent.

description: Number of rooms: 10. This is a small hotel, the only 1 star right on the Grand Canal. Here you'll find a place with charm in the heart of Venice. We'll do our best to make your stay a pleasant one in a clean and welcoming Venetian house. This is the cheapest hotel on the Grand Canal, the perfect location for leisure travelers.
